text.tspan: All of the internal object handles are visible externally?
where does the knowledge of "available filters" live?
I have a pointer to a type Foo. I want to create and connect
to a child of type bar. How do I do that?
What actually creates the sources? That is, what do i have
a handle to in order to create a source of type X?
Does the base class handle knowing how to wire things up?
How does registration with the root container take place?
We have "Creators", which point to Managers, which are in some sense the "owners"
This suggests that we'll need separate creators for
Look, the source creator is basically going to have to know
about all of the possible source elements. The idea
that it would have to wire them up, and potentially
pass in a lot of mutices, isn't the most unreasonable thing
I.e. we can only put it in a pipeline
All elements emit a "destroyed" signal, and have
a "destroy" method. This is effectively a delete.
All elements also have a "visit" method that
takes in a "IVisitor" which can then handle
Pipeline management is actually handled by the GUI
The knowledge about available filters for WaveSourceBase lives
The base class also has to know how to wire things up
